security: Disclosure of covert site locations and agent information could compromise operations and endanger individuals. The memo states, "has requested security approval to use the above site to house a contract Agent...this site is to be terminated on 1 March 1961 and IC/FO has advised that it is leased in alias no security projection can be ascertained."
summary: A memo requesting security approval for a covert site to house a contract agent, LZT/TG (172341), with details on the site's termination date and lease alias.
summary_one_paragraph: On January 19, 1961, Robert J. Leonard sent a memorandum to the Chief of the Cover Support Desk requesting security approval to use Apartment 423 in the Warwick Apartments at 3051 Idaho Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C., as a covert site to house LZT/TG (172341), a contract agent for the Security Research Staff, at the request of Marx Holder who obtained permission from SAC/FO; since the site's lease in alias is set to terminate on March 1, 1961, it is recommended that SB/1 be advised that there is no security objection to the contemplated use of this location.
title: COVERT SITE
